titleStmt.title: [Testimony] 1843 Nov. 4 [of] William H. Thomas regarding the improvements of Rebecca Starritt : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Testimony] 1843 Nov. 4 [of] William H. Thomas regarding the improvements of Rebecca Starritt
bibl.note: This document is a sworn statement given by William H. Thomas. Thomas claims he was employed by Rebecca Starritt in 1838 to help her receive compensation for improvements to her land. Thomas also states that he failed to obtain compensation for Rebecca Starritt. See also pa0252, pa0253, and pa0254.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
County of Washington
Dist District . Columbia
In the year 1838 I was employed by Richard Henson to presuite a claim for his daughter Rebecca for an improvement but failed to obtain any compensation for the claimant.
Preston Starritt married the said Rebecca Henson as I have been informed by her father as well as by the general report in the neighborhood. Nov November . 4 1843

closer.add: Sworn to me this 4' day of November 1843.
closer.signed:
Jno John D McPherson
J.P Justice of the Peace .â€•
